intro: Rondeletia rohrii, commonly known as the golden flame or red rondo, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its striking red or orange tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as an evergreen shrub, reaching heights of up to 2 meters. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and glossy, providing a lush backdrop to its vibrant blooms. Rondeletia rohrii thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in shaded forest understories.
